decision_conditions: The Willow (T40) is situated in the rear garden of 17 Kewferry Drive. Although the tree is not highly visible from Kewferry Road, it is moderately visible to residents living in surrounding gardens and the upper crown is visible over the roof and therefore, it does have a moderate amenity value. The Holly (T41) is situated within the front garden and has a moderate amenity value. Both trees contribute to the amenity value of the area.

The Willow tree has historically been managed as a pollard (last approved in 2018 and every 4 to5 years previously), it is noted that approximately one third of the canopy is currently overhanging the garden of 15 Kewferry Road, however to remove all of this overhang would lead to an unbalanced crown and a difference in the regrowth of the canopy. There is scope to carry out minimal work to ensure the branches are not touching the roof of the outbuilding (however it is also noted that the outbuilding has been newly built and therefore the tree should have
The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.

Clearance of branches touching the outbuildings roof: Work to lift branches off the roof by cutting back secondary and tertiary branches to provide up to 500 mm clearance between the roof and tree branches (i.e. thereby abating the nuisance) does not require the formal consent of the Council.
description: To carry out tree surgery including, pruning back to the boundary line branches overhanging 15 Kewferry Road, One Holly, T40 and One Willow, T41, on TPO 118.
